content: You definitely are in the sweet spot, although as someone who “failed” out of academia, I would say that being in computer science probably helps. As a biomedical engineer, it would have been very difficult for me to have the resources to do cutting edge research at a non-Tier 1 or 2 research university. Not impossible, but much more difficult. I mean correct me if I’m wrong, but in CS don’t you basically just need some computers? If you’re more theoretically bent, maybe not even that.
